column4: hey guys - is it possible to build a livecd from my installed ubuntu system? i want to give my mate one so he can run something called kai - but on livecd - i have it all compiled and running on my system - he isn't very computer literate so i want to make it easy for him
make a vm of it and he can do it that way
he wont want to or know how to use vmware in windows
he doesnt know how to open a vmx file?
nope... i thought a live cd would be the easiest for him - cause then i could setup the rc.local to run everything he needs - he would only have to enter his username and password in kai

what i'm saying is YOU can make the vm for him with all the modules he needs already installed and send it to him or burn as a  data disk and just pull it over to his hd then "voila" he has the preconfigured vm.. the only thing he has to do is "open" and select the .vmx
yeah - i could do that i suppose... i just didn;t want him to have to install anything

I think in the long run it will be easier for him.. heck you can even throw vmware setup on the same disk as your vmx so he wont have to look around for stuff.. my 63yo dad had no problem when i did the same for him
ok :) - thanks for the advice - i think i'll go down that route then
get bchunk - then use "bchunk file.cue file.bin file.iso" and it will convert it to iso - then mount with "mount -t iso9660 -o loop file.iso /media/cdrom"
add -3g after the ntfs there, so it becomes ntfs-3g
then save (make sure ro isn't listed as an option)
then sudo umount -a, then sudo mount -a
now you can write to it
its telling me the device is busy
you have to close anything using the directory and leave it also - so just goto your home folder in xterminal or something and make sure anything accessing stuff on it is closed
then it will work - or at least should
